intro: Massonia zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's massonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in summer. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
